item.title: Rubbish dumping on Almavk Rd on behalf on 38 Mayola rd air bnb, 19th February
item.description:
38 Mayola Rd is an air BnB, we have noticed that guests are consistently dumping rubbish along Almack Rd, it would seem they are being told so by the owner. Rubbish is often all over the street and ripped apart by foxes. Thank you for anything you can do.

item.title: Multiple potholes in estate Road, 19th February
item.description:
Once again multiple deep potholes in estate road. This is a reoccurring problem - the holes get filled and then they crack again very easily. This is damaging cars and not safe for those walking to their cars either. When it rains the whole strip of road ends up filling up with water and a huge puddle is made. The whole road needs completely relaying and levelling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bullace Row, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Holdall with airline sticker dumped outside on public highway, 19th February
item.description:
This has been dumped by someone outside 10B Cantwell Road and is next to their bin on the public highway adjacent to the gate of 10B Cantwell Road. The airline sticker on the bag could be used to identify the owner or origin of the bag. There are multiple items dumped regularly at this this location, usually large bulky furniture items.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cantwell Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Concerns Regarding Traffic Light Operation at A10/M25 Roundabout, 19th February
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to raise concerns regarding the operation of the traffic lights at the A10/M25 roundabout. Over several recent evenings, I have observed traffic at a complete standstill while navigating the roundabout. During these periods, a number of drivers appeared to become frustrated and began proceeding through red lights. As a result, vehicles blocked the exits between successive signal phases, preventing traffic from clearing properly before the next set of lights changed. This pattern of vehicles entering and obstructing the junction seemed to occur across multiple approaches, which in turn caused significant congestion. On each occasion, the backlog extended some distance along the A10 in both directions. In addition to reviewing the signal timings, I would suggest consideration be given to installing red light enforcement cameras at the junction. The presence of cameras that detect and penalise drivers who proceed through red signals may act as a deterrent. This could improve compliance, reduce unsafe manoeuvres, and help prevent the gridlock that occurs when vehicles block the junction. I would be grateful if this matter could be reviewed to determine whether adjustments or enforcement measures may be appropriate. Yours faithfully, YK
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waltham Cross Interchange, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor repair made with tarmac, 19th February
item.description:
Another poor repair made with tarmac instead of replacing the original flagstones. This is a conservation area and as such repairs like this should not be done. I would also be interested to know where the original flagstones went? Please can this be repaired properly and in keeping with the location

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23-29, Queen Elizabeth Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littered street for nearly 2 weeks, 19th February
item.description:
The road is littered with rubbish as noted in photos. This had neon reported and closed within a few hours. However the street has clearly not been cleaned. I witnessed a street cleaner comes early this morning and he barely picked up anything.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gloucester Road, Edmonton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: NRT from Finsbury Sq to Chiswell St, 19th February
item.description:
Report of the NRT not illuminating during restricted hours again. Please confirm if there was any report of a fault on 23/1/26 at 11:32. I believe there to be a fault with these lights as i have enquired many times about the same location and the response is always the same, No Fault Found.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finsbury Square, Finsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
